question.title: Triangle Judgement
question.content:
A pupil Tim gets homework to identify whether three line segments could possibly form a triangle.

 However, this assignment is very heavy because there are hundreds of records to calculate.

Could you help Tim by writing a query to judge whether these three  sides can form a triangle, assuming table triangle holds the length of the three sides x, y and z.

| x  | y  | z  |
|----|----|----|
| 13 | 15 | 30 |
| 10 | 20 | 15 |

 For the sample data above, your query should return the follow result:
 | x  | y  | z  | triangle |
 |----|----|----|----------|
 | 13 | 15 | 30 | No       |
 | 10 | 20 | 15 | Yes      |

rephrased.body: Tim has a homework assignment where he needs to determine if three line segments can form a triangle. Given a table `triangle` with columns `x`, `y`, and `z` representing the lengths of the sides, write a SQL query to help Tim determine if the given sides can form a triangle. A triangle can be formed if the sum of any two sides is greater than the third side.

testcases.explanation:
For the first row (13, 15, 30), 13 + 15 = 28 which is not greater than 30, so it cannot form a triangle.
For the second row (10, 20, 15), 10 + 20 > 15, 10 + 15 > 20 and 20 + 15 > 10, so it can form a triangle.
